qas.question: Who has been referred to as "black people"?
What was the original term related to?
Since when have Indigenous Australians been referred to as black?

answers.text: since the early days of European settlement

qas.question: What does the term relate to know in reference to Australians?

answers.text: to indicate Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander ancestry

context: <a0_0>Indigenous Australians<a0_0/> have been referred to as "black people" in Australia <a2_0>since the early days of European settlement<a2_0/>. While originally related to <a1_0>skin colour<a1_0/>, the term is used to today <a3_0>to indicate Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander ancestry<a3_0/> in general and can refer to people of any skin pigmentation.
